metadata.title: CVE-2019-9518 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a flood of empty frames,potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker sends a stream offrames with an empty payload and without the end-of-stream flag. Theseframes can be DATA, HEADERS, CONTINUATION and/or PUSH_PROMISE. The peerspends time processing each frame disproportionate to attack bandwidth.This can consume excess CPU.

criterions.comment: trafficserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
